questions.question: What is Generative AI?
options: AI that creates new data similar to the training data
questions.explanation: Generative AI models learn from existing data to create new samples that resemble the training data.

questions.question: Which neural network architecture is commonly used in Generative AI for producing images?
questions.explanation: GANs consist of generator and discriminator networks and are widely used for generating realistic images.

questions.question: What is the primary role of the discriminator in a GAN?
options: Distinguish real data from fake data
questions.explanation: The discriminator learns to classify whether data is real or generated by the generator.

questions.question: Which model architecture introduced the attention mechanism extensively used in Generative AI?
questions.explanation: Transformer models use self-attention mechanisms improving sequence modeling in Generative AI.

questions.question: In Generative AI, what does 'prompt engineering' refer to?
options: Designing input queries to generate desired responses
questions.explanation: Prompt engineering involves crafting precise input queries to steer model output effectively.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical application of Generative AI?
questions.explanation: Data encryption is generally outside the scope of Generative AI applications.

questions.question: Which of the following mechanisms is essential in Transformer models in Generative AI?
questions.explanation: Self-attention allows models to weigh the influence of different input tokens effectively.

questions.question: What is 'text-to-image' generation?
options: Converting text into images using Generative AI models
questions.explanation: Text-to-image generation uses textual descriptions to create corresponding images.

questions.question: Which technique is used in Generative AI to prevent a model from overfitting?
questions.explanation: Early stopping stops training when performance on validation data degrades to avoid overfitting.

questions.question: What is the difference between discriminative and generative models?
options: Discriminative models classify data; generative models generate data samples
Generative models classify data; discriminative models generate data samples
questions.explanation: Discriminative models learn decision boundaries, while generative models learn data distributions.

questions.question: Which metric is commonly used to evaluate the quality of generated images in GANs?
questions.explanation: Inception Score assesses the quality and diversity of generated images in GANs.

questions.question: What is 'style transfer' in Generative AI?
options: Applying the artistic style of one image to another
Changing the color palette of images
questions.explanation: Style transfer applies the visual style of an image onto the content of another.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a challenge in Generative AI?
questions.explanation: Label scarcity is more relevant in supervised learning than generative modeling.

questions.question: Which loss function is typically used to train the discriminator in a GAN?
questions.explanation: Binary cross-entropy loss helps the discriminator distinguish real vs generated samples.

questions.question: Which one is an example of a transformer-based large language model?
questions.explanation: GPT (Generative Pretrained Transformer) is a popular transformer-based generative language model.

questions.question: What is the major advantage of transformers over RNNs in sequence modeling?
questions.explanation: Transformers enable parallel computation over sequences unlike RNNs which process sequentially.

questions.question: Which Generative AI technique is widely used to generate realistic human voices?
questions.explanation: WaveNet is a deep generative model effective in producing human-like speech.

questions.question: What does zero-shot learning refer to in Generative AI?
options: Training a model with no data
Model generalizing to new tasks without task-specific training
questions.explanation: Zero-shot learning enables models to perform on new tasks unseen during training.

questions.question: In prompt engineering, what is the significance of temperature parameter?
questions.explanation: Temperature affects creativity vs determinism in generative model outputs.

questions.question: What does 'fine-tuning' a Generative AI model involve?
options: Refining a pre-trained model on a specific dataset
questions.explanation: Fine-tuning adapts a pre-trained model to a new domain or task using new data.

questions.question: What is an autoencoder primarily used for?
questions.explanation: Autoencoders compress and reconstruct data learning compact representations.

questions.question: Which phase involves generating data samples in Generative AI?
questions.explanation: Inference (generation) phase is when the trained model produces new data.

questions.question: In text generation, what is 'beam search' used for?
questions.explanation: Beam search compares multiple generated sequences to select the most probable.

questions.question: What is the common challenge when evaluating generative models?
options: Measuring the quality and diversity of generated data
questions.explanation: Evaluating both fidelity and diversity of generated data is complex and crucial.

questions.question: What defines the 'latent space' in Generative AI?
options: The space of model output samples
A compressed feature space representing input data
questions.explanation: Latent space captures abstract features in a compact representation used for generation.

questions.question: Which dataset is commonly used to benchmark image generation models?
questions.explanation: ImageNet's large set of labeled images is common for training and evaluation.

questions.question: What is 'mode collapse' in GANs?
options: Generator produces limited variety of outputs
questions.explanation: Mode collapse happens when the generator outputs lack diversity and collapse to few modes.

questions.question: Which Generative AI application involves modifying videos to create fake but realistic footage?
questions.explanation: Deepfake uses Generative AI to create hyper-realistic synthetic audio/video.

questions.question: What role do embeddings play in Generative AI?
options: Encode data into continuous vector spaces capturing semantic meaning
questions.explanation: Embeddings transform data into numerical vectors that preserve semantic similarities.

questions.question: Which approach allows Generative AI models to learn from smaller datasets by leveraging knowledge from larger datasets?
questions.explanation: Pretraining on large corpora followed by fine-tuning enables efficient learning on smaller datasets.

questions.question: Which architecture is commonly used for image generation in Generative AI?
questions.explanation: GANs consist of a generator and discriminator network and are widely used for generating realistic images.

questions.question: What does the 'latent space' represent in Generative AI models?
options: Compressed features that represent essential characteristics
questions.explanation: Latent space is a lower-dimensional representation encoding important features for data generation or reconstruction.

questions.question: What is 'style transfer' in Generative AI?
options: Applying the style of one image to the content of another
questions.explanation: Style transfer involves reimagining an image with the artistic style of another using neural networks.

questions.question: In transformer-based Generative AI models, what is the role of self-attention?
options: Weigh the importance of different elements of input when generating output
questions.explanation: Self-attention helps the model understand relationships between different parts of input data effectively.

questions.question: Which metric is often used to measure GAN-generated image quality?
questions.explanation: Inception Score evaluates the quality and diversity of images generated by GANs.

questions.question: What is the primary difference between discriminative and generative models?
options: Discriminative models classify data; generative models learn data distribution to generate data
Generative models classify data; discriminative models generate data
questions.explanation: Generative models learn the underlying data distribution, while discriminative models focus on classification boundaries.

questions.question: What is 'prompt engineering' in the context of Generative AI?
options: Designing input prompts to elicit desired outputs from AI models
questions.explanation: Prompt engineering involves crafting effective input queries to guide Generative AI models toward specific outputs.

questions.question: Which Generative AI model uses a two-part adversarial training setup?
questions.explanation: GANs use a generator to produce data and a discriminator to distinguish real from generated data in adversarial training.

questions.question: What is zero-shot learning in the context of Generative AI?
options: Training a model without any data
Ability to perform tasks without prior specific training on them
questions.explanation: Zero-shot learning allows models to generalize and perform new tasks without being explicitly trained on them.

questions.question: What is a major application of Generative AI in the entertainment industry?
options: Automated content generation such as music, art, and scripts
questions.explanation: Generative AI is widely used to create novel content like music, artwork, and story scripts.
